result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvia M Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sylvia M Taylor is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sylvia M Taylor was found guilty of Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sylvia M Taylor in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for jury status hearing.  Defense would like to proceed with a change of plea at this time with an adjourned sentencing date.  No objection by the State.  Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 5,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1 and 7 dismissed and read in.  Count 6 dismissed on prosecutor's motion.  Counts 2-4 were previously dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Sylvia M Taylor in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Susan Behling from the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Kerner. Redirect by Atty. Boese. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Atty. Kerner objects to the bind over and provides closing statements and requests complaint be dismissed as the State has not met the burden. State will be filing additional information.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. State requests an arraignment date to file the information. Motion for De Novo Review of Ruling of Court Commissioner filed by Atty Kerner.

Defendant Sylvia M Taylor in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kerner asks the court to address their motion to dismiss.  State did receive a copy of the motion and is ready to proceed today.  Atty. Kerner presents arguments to the court.  Atty. Boese presents arguments to the court.  Rebuttal by Atty. Kerner.  Court questions counsel.  Court finds probable cause in the criminal complaint and will deny the motion to dismiss.  Atty. Kerner is requesting a De Novo review of the Court's decision today. Court will indicate that defense has 10-days to file the motion for de novo review and once filed will request a hearing date with Judge Aprahamian.  Court will note that the time limits for preliminary hearing were previously waived.
